text: sure
hi everyone 4th annie shertano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new domi and
jd beck album not tight this is the
debut full-length lp of two musical
prodigies domi and jd beck the latter is
a drummer the former a keyboardist and
both are
mind-blowingly good at what they do
they've also been tearing it up lately
with a series of home recorded live
performances which are very impressive
and have been snatched up and put onto
anderson pack's ape label say what
you will about their come up but if
anybody's proven themselves to be
talented enough to be plucked up out of
the internet and start working with
anderson pack performing late night tv
it's these two so of course anderson
features on this project and no doubt
the connections that domi and jd have
made through their talent and through
anderson's label have led to appearances
with thundercat and mac demarco on this
thing snoop dogg as well as busta rhymes
it's also cool to see this record being
released via universal's blue note
records which is uh industry speak for
jazz as domi and jd are playing nothing
if not that the music on this lp is an
intensely funky dense brand of jazz
fusion with notes of hip-hop electronic
music and the chemistry between domi and
jd is just amazing incredible
mind-blowing which you can hear right
from the first couple of full-length
tracks which take an instrumental
approach the track what up features lots
of tight speedy relentless drumming a
sweet and sour chord progression
dizzying solos like many of the
performance videos these two have
uploaded to the internet this track
reads sort of like an informal jam but
there's enough performance highlights
along its run time to be placed on here
as a proper track same thing goes for
the track smile where domi brings a sort
of stuttering lead melody to guide the
way the chord progression on this one is
pretty quaint too and do not miss the
very strong synth bass and drum solos
the one thing i will say is slightly
holding tracks like this back though is
just the sound play or lack there of the
mix on this track and many others here
is so freaking dry which is maybe not as
much of a factor when there is a feature
on a song just kind of gives you another
sound another element to pay attention
to the sweet and gentle vocal harmonies
from thundercat on bowling are quite
nice but the track does end pretty
abruptly out of nowhere so as a result
of that structurally it does feel a
little half-baked while domi and jd
can't certainly jam their way through
nearly any situation methodically
planning a song out from beginning to
end doesn't seem to be in the plan
sometimes i get a lot more out of the
jam they forge on the track not tight
which feels like this insane experiment
with a set of cords that just refuse to
resolve there's an endless sense of
tension to them and they ride over this
oddly shaped groove that it seems like
domi and jd are trying to execute as
smoothly as possible in that sense i
would say mission accomplished because i
don't know whether or not to be on the
edge of my seat with this one being laid
back and chilling either way the clashed
up vibe on this track is truly unique
and is going to keep me coming back to
this one for a while plus those dueling
solo passages between domi and
thundercat are just absolutely sick
herbie hancock's piano embellishments on
moon are pretty gorgeous and an
essential addition to this track the
only thing really holding this one back
are the somewhat muddy and muted vocoder
vocals which i think could have come
through more boldly then mac demarco
find some smooth pockets to sing in on
the track two shrimps there's something
kind of surreal and haunting about his
tiny and boyish delivery on this one
especially with that splash of reverb on
it but the crown jewel collaboration on
this project is easily take a chance
with anderson pack which features one of
the
best melodies that i've heard this year
narratively the track's a smart concept
about growing love changing into a
better person and hoping that this uh
individual who you've been with for a
very long time is still there with you
on the other side of that change
anderson's skilled and thoughtful verses
are a treat as are his pre-choruses and
the outro so yeah those are some
highlights but there are some moments in
the second half here that i'm a little
indifferent toward like the very woozy
sounding duke which i think has a warped
quality to it i find kind of refreshing
but it seems like domi and jd don't have
too many compositional plans for it
outside of like hitting this particular
vibe and then letting the song just kind
of disappear out of nowhere there are
also some unflatteringly sour solo
passages on the track space mountain
which i think are also not helped by as
i was saying earlier that persistently
dry production which does yes provide a
lot of clarity but also not really a
whole lot of color still that is
slightly made up for by how insane some
of the performances are here dami's solo
passages on what sounds like a little
live studio performance uh with the song
sniff are mind melting and you know what
the track featuring snoop dogg and busta
rhymes and anderson pack on here is
pretty gratifying as well certainly one
more reminder in the tracklist of how
great of a track these two can pull
together when they're structuring it out
like a formal song bring in a verse
bring in another verse bring in a chorus
those moments on this thing are pretty
consistently good
the jams as far as how gratifying and
well-developed they are can be sort of
hit or miss but with all that being said
this record is generally very good and
shows an incredible amount of potential
between dami and jd obviously their
playing respectively is amazing and
their chemistry together is next level
and if the next time around they could
bring in more color more layers more
instrumentation maybe more guests more
songs or jams that are lengthier more
well developed that would lead to an
even more impressive project i'm sure
i'm feeling a strong six to a light
seven on this one transition have you
given this record a listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up worthy link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
domi and jd beck
forever
